features.featureTitle: Redesign the Drawing Guide walkthrough view on the Results page so that each stage is presented as a distinct card block containing: (1) a bold step title (e.g. 'Step 1: Trace the Outlines'), (2) a paragraph of instructional body text explaining what to do at that stage, and (3) a full-width rounded image showing the processed stage output — all stacked vertically, matching the card-per-step layout shown in the reference screenshot (white card on light grey background, title in large bold sans-serif, description text below it, then the stage image in a rounded rectangle container). All five stage cards should be visible on the page by scrolling, one after another.

Update the HowItWorks page timeline to use the same card-per-step visual layout: each stage entry becomes a standalone card with the step number and title as a bold heading, the descriptive body text beneath it, and a representative stage preview image below the text — mirroring the reference screenshot's structure.
